</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Future issuances of shares of our common stock could dilute the ownership interests of our
	stockholders.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Any issuance of equity securities could dilute the interests of our stockholders and could substantially decrease the trading price of
	our common stock. We may issue equity securities in the future for a number of reasons, including to finance our operations and business strategy (including in connection with acquisitions, strategic
	collaborations or other transactions), to adjust our ratio of debt to equity, to satisfy our obligations upon the exercise of outstanding options or for other&nbsp;reasons.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	August&nbsp;2011, we issued $100&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of our 3.75% Convertible Senior Notes due August&nbsp;1, 2016 (the&nbsp;3.75% Convertible Notes), and
	in February&nbsp;2013, we issued $115&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of our 3.50% Convertible Senior Notes due February&nbsp;1, 2018 (the&nbsp;3.50% Convertible Notes). In
	April&nbsp;2014, we issued approximately $70.3&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of our 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Senior Notes due February&nbsp;1, 2018 (the&nbsp;3.50%
	Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes, and collectively with the 3.75% Convertible Notes and the 3.50% Convertible Notes, the Convertible Notes) and paid approximately $0.4&nbsp;million in cash to
	refinance approximately $70.3&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of our 3.50% Convertible Notes. Following such transactions, approximately
	$44.7&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of the 3.50% Convertible Notes remained outstanding. To the extent we issue common stock upon conversion of any outstanding Convertible Notes, that
	conversion would dilute the ownership interests of our stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Increased leverage as a result of the Convertible Notes offering may harm our financial condition
	and operating results.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As of June&nbsp;30, 2016, we had total consolidated liabilities of approximately $409.4&nbsp;million, including the short-term
	liability component of the 3.75% Convertible Notes in the amount of $36.4&nbsp;million and the Term Loan of $3.5&nbsp;million, and the long-term liability component of the 3.50% Convertible Notes
	in the amount of $43.2&nbsp;million and the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes of $66.6&nbsp;million as well as the Term Loan in the amount of $60.7&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April&nbsp;2014, we refinanced approximately $70.3&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of the 3.50% Convertible Notes held by certain investors (the&nbsp;Participating
	Holders) with approximately $70.3&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes. In connection with such transactions, we also paid the Participating Holders
	approximately $0.4&nbsp;million in&nbsp;cash.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On
	January&nbsp;11, 2016, the Company closed a $70.0&nbsp;million debt financing agreement with Cerberus Business Finance,&nbsp;LLC, an affiliate of Cerberus Capital Management,
	L.P (the&nbsp;Secured Loan). The net proceeds of the loan are required to be used, in addition to $30.0&nbsp;million of cash funded by the Company, to retire $100.0&nbsp;million of Convertible
	Notes at the earlier of August&nbsp;2016 or when otherwise redeemed. This financing consists of a $70.0&nbsp;million first lien senior secured term loan with a 700&nbsp;basis point margin and
	1&nbsp;percent LIBOR floor. The loan principal amount will be amortized at an effective rate of 5% annually with final payment due in 5&nbsp;years and is subject to certain maintenance-based
	covenants. The Secured Loan also includes certain financial covenants, customary events of default, and other customary covenants that limit, among other things, the ability of the Company and its
	subsidiaries to (i)&nbsp;incur indebtedness, (ii)&nbsp;incur liens on their property, (iii)&nbsp;pay dividends or make other distributions, (iv)&nbsp;sell their assets, (v)&nbsp;make certain
	loans or investments, (vi)&nbsp;merge or consolidate, (vii)&nbsp;voluntarily repay or prepay certain indebtedness and (viii)&nbsp;enter into transactions with affiliates, in each case subject to
	certain exceptions. As required by the terms of the financing, upon the closing of the financing in January&nbsp;2016, we used a portion of the net proceeds from the financing to repurchase
	approximately $63.4&nbsp;million in aggregate principal amount of the 3.75% Convertible Notes for $66.6&nbsp;million in cash. In August&nbsp;2016, we settled the remaining approximately
	$36.6&nbsp;million in aggregate principal amount of the 3.75% Convertible Notes and accrued interest for $37.3&nbsp;million in&nbsp;cash.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	55
</FONT>
</P>

<DL COMPACT>

</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	The conditional conversion features of the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes, if triggered,
	may adversely affect our financial condition and operating results.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In the event the conditional conversion features of the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes are triggered, holders of the 3.50%
	Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes will be entitled to convert such notes at any time during specified periods at their option. If one or more holders elect to convert such notes, unless we elect to
	satisfy our conversion obligation by delivering solely shares of
	our common stock (other than paying solely cash in lieu of any fractional share), including if we have irrevocably elected full physical settlement upon conversion, we would be required to make cash
	payments to satisfy all or a portion of our conversion obligation based on the applicable conversion rate, which could adversely affect our liquidity. In addition, even if holders do not elect to
	convert such notes, if we have irrevocably elected net share settlement upon conversion we could be required under applicable accounting rules to reclassify all or a portion of the outstanding
	principal of such notes as a current rather than long-term liability, which could result in a material reduction of our net working capital.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	3.50% Convertible Notes do not provide for such a conditional conversion feature.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	Provisions in the indenture for the Convertible Notes, our certificate of incorporation and our
	bylaws could discourage or prevent a takeover, even if an acquisition would be beneficial in the opinion of our stockholders.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Provisions of our certificate of incorporation and bylaws could make it more difficult for a third-party to acquire us, even if doing
	so would be beneficial in the opinion of our stockholders. These provisions include:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	authorizing the issuance of "blank check" preferred stock that could be issued by our board of directors to increase the number of
	outstanding shares and thwart a takeover attempt;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	establishing a classified board of directors, which could discourage a takeover attempt;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	prohibiting cumulative voting in the election of directors, which would limit the ability of less than a majority of stockholders to
	elect director candidates;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	limiting the ability of stockholders to call special meetings of stockholders;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	prohibiting stockholder action by written consent and requiring that all stockholder actions be taken at a meeting of our
	stockholders;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	establishing advance notice requirements for nominations for election to the board of directors or for proposing matters that can be
	acted upon by stockholders at stockholder meetings.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	56
</FONT>
</P>

<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=56,EFW="2229520",CP="ACCURAY INCORPORATED",DN="1",CHK=329726,FOLIO='56',FILE='DISK123:[16ZBP1.16ZBP77301]DO77301A.;14',USER='ABEAULI',CD='22-AUG-2016;18:42' -->
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DO77301_1_57">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	addition, Section&nbsp;203 of the Delaware General Corporation Law may discourage, delay or prevent a change of control of our company. Generally, Section&nbsp;203 prohibits
	stockholders who, alone or together with their affiliates and associates, own more than 15% of the subject company from engaging in certain business combinations for a period of three years following
	the date that the stockholder became an interested stockholder of such subject company without approval of the board or 66
<SUP>
	2
</SUP>
	/
<SMALL>
	3
</SMALL>
	% of the independent stockholders. The existence of these
	provisions could adversely affect the voting power of holders of common stock and limit the price that investors might be willing to pay in the future for shares of our common&nbsp;stock.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A
	change of control will also trigger an event of default under our term loan credit facility. If an event of default occurs, the collateral agent may, at its discretion, declare all or
	any portion of the loan then-outstanding under the loan credit facility, including all accrued but unpaid interest thereon, applicable fees and early payment premiums, to be accelerated and
	immediately due and&nbsp;payable.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Furthermore,
	if a "fundamental change" (as&nbsp;such terms are defined in each the indentures of the Convertible Notes) occurs, holders of the Convertible Notes will have the right, at
	their option, to require us to repurchase all or a portion of their Convertible Notes. A "fundamental change" generally occurs when there is a change in control of Accuray (acquisition of 50% or more
	of our voting stock, liquidation or sale of Accuray not for stock) or trading of our stock is terminated. In the event of a "make-whole fundamental change" (as&nbsp;such term is defined in each of
	the indentures for the Convertible Notes), we may also be required to increase the conversion rate applicable to the Convertible Notes surrendered for conversion in connection with such make-whole
	fundamental
	change. A "make-whole fundamental change" is generally a sale of Accuray not for stock in another publicly traded company. In addition, each of the indentures for the Convertible Notes prohibits us
	from engaging in certain mergers or acquisitions unless, among other things, the surviving entity assumes our obligations under the Convertible Notes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	We have not paid dividends in the past and do not expect to pay dividends in the foreseeable future.
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have never declared or paid cash dividends on our capital stock. We currently intend to retain all future earnings for the operation
	and expansion of our business and, therefore, do not anticipate declaring or paying cash dividends in the foreseeable future. The payment of dividends will be at the discretion of our board of
	directors and will depend on our results of operations, capital requirements, financial condition, prospects, contractual arrangements, and other factors our board of directors may deem relevant. If
	we do not pay dividends, a return on a stockholders' investment will only occur if our stock price appreciates.
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_RISK_FACTORS>

<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Facilities
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We currently lease approximately 164,000&nbsp;square&nbsp;feet of product development, manufacturing and administrative space in
	three buildings in Sunnyvale, California, as&nbsp;follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	A manufacturing building totaling approximately 50,000&nbsp;square&nbsp;feet, which is leased to us until
	December&nbsp;2018;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Two headquarters buildings that are approximately 74,000&nbsp;square&nbsp;feet and 40,000&nbsp;square&nbsp;feet, respectively,
	which are leased to us until December&nbsp;2023. We have the right to renew the lease term of our headquarters office buildings for two five-year terms upon prior written notice and the fulfillment
	of certain conditions.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	wholly owned subsidiary, TomoTherapy Incorporated leases approximately 153,000&nbsp;square&nbsp;feet of product development, manufacturing and administrative space in three
	buildings in Madison, Wisconsin, as&nbsp;follows:

	June&nbsp;2018;&nbsp;and

</FONT>

	April&nbsp;2019.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

	wholly owned subsidiary, Accuray International Sarl, leases two office buildings totaling approximately 15,000&nbsp;square&nbsp;feet of administrative space in Morges,
	Switzerland, which are leased to Accuray International until June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2018.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	addition, our wholly-owned subsidiary, Accuray Accelerator Technology Company Limited, leases approximately 26,000&nbsp;square&nbsp;feet of space in a manufacturing facility in
	Chengdu, China until July&nbsp;2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	directly or through our subsidiaries, also maintain offices in: Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania; Durham, North Carolina; France; China; Hong Kong; Japan; Spain; India; Russia; Germany;
	Belgium; Brazil; and the United Arab&nbsp;Emirates.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	believe our current facilities are adequate to meet our current needs, but additional space, including additional radiation shielded areas in which systems can be assembled and
	tested, may be required in the future to accommodate anticipated increases in manufacturing needs.
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	have never paid cash dividends on our common stock. Our Board of Directors intends to use any future earnings to support operations and reinvest in the growth and development of our
	business. There are no current plans to pay cash dividends to common stockholders in the foreseeable future.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of August&nbsp;15, 2016, there were 230&nbsp;registered stockholders of record of our common stock. Because many of our shares of common stock are held by brokers or other
	institutions on behalf of stockholders, we are unable to estimate the total number of beneficial stockholders.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, there were no sales of unregistered equity securities by the&nbsp;Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	January&nbsp;2016 and August&nbsp;2016, the Company repurchased approximately $63.4&nbsp;million and $36.6&nbsp;million, respectively, in aggregate principal amount of its
	3.75% Convertible Senior Notes due August&nbsp;2016 for approximately $103.9&nbsp;million in cash. As $100.0&nbsp;million of the 3.75% Convertible Senior Notes were settled in cash, the Company
	avoided the issuance of approximately 10.6&nbsp;million new common equity shares, representing a potential dilution of approximately 13&nbsp;percent of its common stock as of
	June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company does not have a stock repurchase program and has not made any share repurchase, excluding repurchases to satisfy minimum tax withholdings, during the year ended
	June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	59
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Stock Performance Graph
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The graph set forth below compares the cumulative total stockholder return on our common stock between June&nbsp;30, 2011 and
	June&nbsp;30, 2016, with the cumulative total return of (i)&nbsp;the S&amp;P Healthcare Index and (ii)&nbsp;the Nasdaq Composite Index, over the same period. This graph assumes the investment of
	$100.00 on June&nbsp;30, 2011 in our common stock, the S&amp;P Healthcare Index and the Nasdaq Composite Index, and assumes the reinvestment of dividends, if&nbsp;any.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_DO77301_COMPARISON_OF_5_YEAR_CUMULATIV__COM05121">
</A>
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DO77301_7">
</A>
<BR>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	COMPARISON OF&nbsp;5 YEAR CUMULATIVE TOTAL RETURN*
<BR>
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Among Accuray Incorporated, the NASDAQ Composite Index, and the S&amp;P Health Care&nbsp;Index
<BR>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/08/24/0001047469-16-015108_G385705.JPG" ALT="GRAPHIC" WIDTH="642" HEIGHT="346">
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	*
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	$100
	invested on 6/30/11&nbsp;in stock or index, including reinvestment of&nbsp;dividends.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	comparisons shown in the graph above are based upon historical data. We caution that the stock price performance shown in the graph above is not necessarily indicative of, nor is it
	intended to forecast, the potential future performance of our common stock. Information used in the graph was obtained from Research Data Group, a source believed to be reliable, but we are not
	responsible for any errors or omissions in such information.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following selected consolidated financial data should be read in conjunction with, and are qualified by reference to, our
	consolidated financial statements and related notes and "Management's Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations" appearing elsewhere in this Form&nbsp;10-K. The
	consolidated statements of operations for the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, and the consolidated balance sheet data at June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015 are derived from, and are
	qualified by reference to, the consolidated financial statements that have been audited by our independent registered public accounting firm, which are included elsewhere in this Form&nbsp;10-K. The
	consolidated statements of operations data for the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2013 and 2012 and the consolidated balance sheet data at June&nbsp;30, 2014, 2013 and 2012 is derived from our audited
	consolidated financial statements not included in this Form&nbsp;10-K.

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	On
	December&nbsp;21, 2012, we entered into a Purchase Agreement and Release with Compact Particle Acceleration Corporation (CPAC), under which all the
	equity and debt investments held by us in CPAC were purchased by CPAC for a nominal consideration. As a result of the Purchase Agreement and Release, we concluded that we were no longer the primary
	beneficiary of CPAC, and therefore, deconsolidated CPAC as of December&nbsp;21, 2012. The results of operations of CPAC, including the loss on deconsolidation of CPAC and the losses attributable to
	the non-controlling interest recorded for the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2013 and 2012 have been reported as discontinued operations.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
</EFX_FINANCIAL_DATA>
<EFX_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION>
<A NAME="FIS_MANAGEMENTS_DISCUSSION"></A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_DQ77301_ITEM_7__MANAGEMENT_S_DISCUSSIO__ITE03668">
</A>
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_TOC_DQ77301_2">
</A>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Item&nbsp;7.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;MANAGEMENT'S DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS OF FINANCIAL CONDITION AND RESULTS OF&nbsp;OPERATIONS
<BR>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	You should read the following discussion of our consolidated financial condition and results of operations in
	conjunction with the financial statements and the notes thereto included elsewhere in this report. The following discussion contains forward-looking statements that reflect our plans, estimates and
	beliefs. Our actual results could differ materially from those discussed in the forward-looking statements. Factors that could cause or contribute to these differences include those discussed below
	and elsewhere in this report on Form&nbsp;10-K, particularly in "Risk Factors." See "Special Note Regarding Forward-Looking Statements."
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Overview
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Products and Markets
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Company
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are a radiation oncology company that develops, manufactures, sells and supports precise, innovative treatment solutions which set
	the standard of care, with the aim of helping patients live longer, better lives. Our leading edge technologies, the CyberKnife and TomoTherapy Systems, are designed to deliver advanced radiation
	therapy including radiosurgery, stereotactic body radiation therapy, intensity modulated radiation therapy, image guided radiation therapy and adaptive radiation therapy tailored to the specific needs
	of each patient. The CyberKnife and TomoTherapy Systems are complementary offerings serving separate patient populations treated by the same medical specialty, radiation oncology, with advanced
	capabilities that offer increased treatment flexibility to meet the needs of an expanding patient population.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	CyberKnife Systems are robotic systems designed to deliver radiosurgery treatments to cancer tumors anywhere in the body. The CyberKnife Systems are the only dedicated, full-body
	robotic radiosurgery systems on the market. Radiosurgery is an alternative to traditional surgery for tumors and is performed on an outpatient basis in one to five treatment sessions. It enables the
	treatment of patients who otherwise would not be treated with radiation, who may not be good candidates for surgery, or who desire non-surgical treatments. The use of radiosurgery with CyberKnife
	Systems to
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	62
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=62,EFW="2229520",CP="ACCURAY INCORPORATED",DN="1",CHK=514917,FOLIO='62',FILE='DISK123:[16ZBP1.16ZBP77301]DQ77301A.;21',USER='ABEAULI',CD='22-AUG-2016;18:45' -->
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DQ77301_1_63">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	treat
	tumors throughout the body has grown significantly in recent years, but currently represents only a small portion of the patients who develop tumors treatable with CyberKnife Systems. A
	determination of when it may or may not be appropriate to use a CyberKnife System for treatment is at the discretion of the treating physician and depends on the specific patient. However, the
	CyberKnife Systems are generally not used to treat (1)&nbsp;very large tumors, which are considerably wider than the radiation beam that can be delivered by CyberKnife Systems, (2)&nbsp;diffuse
	wide-spread disease, as is often the case for late stage cancers, because they are not localized (though CyberKnife Systems might be used to treat a focal area of the disease) and (3)&nbsp;systemic
	diseases, like leukemia and lymphoma, which are not localized to an organ, but rather involve cells throughout the body. The addition of the InCise MLC in 2013, now makes it faster and more efficient
	to treat a wider range of tumor types with the CyberKnife M6, including larger tumors and those with multiple sites of&nbsp;disease.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
	CyberKnife M6&nbsp;Series Systems have the option of: fixed collimator, Iris collimator, and/or InCise MLC. The InCise MLC is designed specifically for the M6&nbsp;Series. With
	the addition of the InCise MLC, clinicians can deliver the same precise radiosurgery treatments they have come to expect with the CyberKnife System, faster and for a wider range of tumor types. The
	InCise MLC was commercially launched in the third fiscal quarter of&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	believe the long term success of the CyberKnife Systems is dependent on a number of factors including the&nbsp;following:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Continued adoption of our CyberKnife M6&nbsp;Series Systems;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Production and shipment of MLC that meets the standards that we, and our customers, expect in our&nbsp;products;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Change in medical practice leading to utilization of stereotactic body radiosurgery more regularly as an alternative to surgery or
	other treatments;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Greater awareness among doctors and patients of the benefits of radiosurgery with the CyberKnife Systems;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Continued evolution in clinical studies demonstrating the safety, efficacy and other benefits of using the CyberKnife Systems to treat
	tumors in various parts of the&nbsp;body;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Continued advances in technology that improve the quality of treatments and ease of use of the CyberKnife Systems;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Improved access to radiosurgery with the CyberKnife Systems in various countries through regulatory approvals;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Medical insurance reimbursement policies that cover CyberKnife System treatments;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Expansion of sales of CyberKnife Systems in countries throughout the world.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	TomoTherapy Systems are advanced, fully integrated and versatile radiation therapy systems for the treatment of a wide range of cancer types. The TomoTherapy Systems are the only
	radiation therapy systems designed for image-guided intensity-modulated radiation therapy (IG-IMRT). The TomoTherapy H Series Systems come in configurations of TomoH, TomoHD and TomoHDA. Based on a CT
	scanner platform, the systems provide continuous delivery of radiation from 360&nbsp;degrees around the patient, or delivery from clinician-specified beam angles. These unique features, combined
	with daily 3D image guidance, enable physicians to deliver highly accurate, individualized dose distributions which precisely conform to the shape of the patient's tumor while minimizing dose to
	normal, healthy tissue, resulting in fewer side effects for patients. The TomoTherapy Systems are capable of treating all standard radiation therapy indications including breast, prostate, lung and
	head and neck cancers, in addition to complex treatments such as total marrow irradiation. Radiation therapy has been widely available and used in developed countries for decades, though many
	developing countries do not
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	63
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=63,EFW="2229520",CP="ACCURAY INCORPORATED",DN="1",CHK=85558,FOLIO='63',FILE='DISK123:[16ZBP1.16ZBP77301]DQ77301A.;21',USER='ABEAULI',CD='22-AUG-2016;18:45' -->
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DQ77301_1_64">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	currently
	have a sufficient number of radiation therapy systems to adequately treat their domestic cancer patient populations. The number of radiation therapy systems in use and sold each year is
	currently many times larger than the number of radiosurgery systems. We believe the TomoTherapy Systems offer clinicians and patients significant benefits over other radiation therapy systems in the
	market. We believe our ability to capture more sales will be influenced by a number of factors including the&nbsp;following:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Continued adoption of our TomoTherapy H Series Systems;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Greater awareness among doctors and patients of the benefits of radiation therapy using TomoTherapy Systems;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Advances in technology which improve the quality of treatments and ease of use of TomoTherapy Systems;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Greater awareness among doctors of the now-established reliability of TomoTherapy Systems;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Expansion of TomoTherapy System sales in countries throughout the world.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	2016 we received FDA and CE Mark approval for the new Radixact Treatment Delivery Platform. We also received 510(k) clearance for our new treatment planning and data management
	systems, Accuray Precision Treatment Planning System and iDMS Data Management System. These next generation hardware and software solutions which, together, make up the new Radixact System, enable
	faster, more efficient delivery of extremely precise treatment to a wider range of cancer patients, including those undergoing retreatment. The new Radixact System represents a major step forward in
	the evolution of the TomoTherapy System in treatment speed and ease of&nbsp;use.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Sale of Our Products
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Generating revenue from the sale of our systems is a lengthy process. Selling our systems, from first contact with a potential customer
	to a signed sales contract that meets backlog criteria varies significantly and generally spans six months to two years. The time from receipt of a signed contract to revenue recognition is governed
	generally by the time required by the customer to build, renovate or prepare the treatment room for installation of the&nbsp;system.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	the United&nbsp;States, we primarily market directly to customers, including hospitals and stand-alone treatment facilities, through our sales organization and we also market to
	customers through sales agents and group purchasing organizations. Outside the United&nbsp;States, we market to customers directly and through distributors and some sales agents. We have sales and
	service offices in many countries in Europe, Japan and other countries in Asia, South America, and throughout the&nbsp;world.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Backlog
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For orders that cover both products and services, only the portion of the order that is recognizable as product revenue is reported as
	backlog. The portion of the order that is
	recognized as service revenue (for&nbsp;example, Post Contract Customer Support (PCS), installation, training and professional services) is not included in reported backlog. Product backlog totaled
	$405.9&nbsp;million as of June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	order for the product portion of a system sales agreement to be counted as backlog, it must meet the following criteria:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The contract is signed and properly executed by both the customer and us. A customer purchase order that is signed and incorporates
	the terms of our contract quote will be considered equivalent to a signed and executed contract;
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	64
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=64,EFW="2229520",CP="ACCURAY INCORPORATED",DN="1",CHK=738012,FOLIO='64',FILE='DISK123:[16ZBP1.16ZBP77301]DQ77301A.;21',USER='ABEAULI',CD='22-AUG-2016;18:45' -->
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DQ77301_1_65">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The contract has either cleared all its contingencies or contained no contingencies when&nbsp;signed;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	We have received a minimum deposit or a letter of credit; the sale is a direct channel sale to a government entity, or the product has
	shipped to a customer with credit sufficient to cover the minimum deposit;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The specific end customer site has been identified by the customer in the written contract or written amendment;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	For orders in our Latin America region, unless the system has already shipped and collection is reasonably assured, we request
	supporting evidence that the end customer has commenced construction to place our products if the site does not already exist;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Less than 2.5&nbsp;years have passed since the contract met all the criteria above.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Although
	our backlog includes only contractual agreements with our customers for the purchase of systems and related upgrades, we cannot provide assurance that we will convert backlog
	into recognized revenue due primarily to factors outside our control. Our backlog is primarily impacted by three items: cancellations, age-outs and foreign currency fluctuations. Orders could be
	cancelled for reasons including, without limitation, changes in customers' needs or financial condition, changes in government or health insurance reimbursement policies, changes to regulatory
	requirements. In addition to cancellations, after 2.5&nbsp;years, if we have not been able to recognize revenue on a contract, we remove the revenue associated with the contract from backlog and the
	order is considered aged out. Contracts may age out for many reasons, including but not limited to inability of the customer to pay, inability of the customer to adapt their facilities to accommodate
	our products in a timely manner, or inability to timely obtain licenses necessary for customer facilities or operation of our equipment. Our backlog also includes amounts not denominated in
	U.S.&nbsp;Dollars and therefore fluctuations in the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar compared to other currencies will impact backlog. Generally, strengthening in the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar will negatively
	impact&nbsp;backlog.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gross
	orders are defined as the sum of new orders recorded during the period adjusted for any revisions to existing orders during the period. Net product orders are defined as gross
	product orders less cancellations, age-outs and foreign exchange adjustments.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Gross
	orders increased by $16.1&nbsp;million for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, as compared to the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. Gross orders increased by $4.4&nbsp;million
	for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, as compared to the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2014. These increases were due to increased order volume year over year. In fiscal 2016, TomoTherapy System order
	volume increased 11% year over year and CyberKnife System order volume increased 13% year over year. In fiscal 2015, TomoTherapy System order volume increased 17% year over year and CyberKnife System
	order volume increased 12% year over&nbsp;year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	orders increased by $35.3&nbsp;million for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, as compared to the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, resulting from the increase in gross orders of
	$16.1&nbsp;million plus an increase of $25.2&nbsp;million because of favorable currency impacts partially offset by an increase in cancellations of $2.2&nbsp;million and an increase in age-outs
	of $3.8&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The age-outs of $54.7&nbsp;million for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 include $12.1&nbsp;million of age-ins which represent
	orders that previously aged-out but have been taken to revenue in the current period. Age-ins offset the gross amount of age-outs in a particular period. There were $4.0&nbsp;million of age-ins
	included in age-outs of $50.9&nbsp;million for the year ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	65
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=65,EFW="2229520",CP="ACCURAY INCORPORATED",DN="1",CHK=450662,FOLIO='65',FILE='DISK123:[16ZBP1.16ZBP77301]DQ77301A.;21',USER='ABEAULI',CD='22-AUG-2016;18:45' -->
<UL>
<UL>
</UL>
</UL>
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DS77301_1_66">
</A>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_BASECOLOR,"BLACK" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DEFAULTFONT,"FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLESHADECOLOR,"#CCEEFF" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_STABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_SCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_DCRTABLERULES,"BORDER-BOTTOM:DOUBLE #000000 2.25PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT;" -->
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Cancellations were $13.8&nbsp;million and $11.6&nbsp;million in the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
	Cancellations are outside of our control and difficult to forecast; however, we continue to work closely with our customers to minimize the impact of cancellations on our&nbsp;business.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Currency impacts resulted in an increase in net orders of $8.9&nbsp;million and a decrease of $16.3&nbsp;million in the year ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015, respectively. In fiscal 2016, order backlog increased because of a strengthening of foreign currencies, mainly the Japanese Yen against the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar.
	Conversely, when the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar strengthens, such as it did in fiscal 2015, having contracts based in several currencies such as Euro and Japanese Yen resulted in a negative impact on
	net&nbsp;orders.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Net
	orders decreased by $32.0&nbsp;million for year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, as compared to the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2014, resulting from the decrease of $16.3&nbsp;million
	due to foreign currency impacts and a decrease of $12.6&nbsp;million due to age-outs and an increase in cancellations of $7.5&nbsp;million partially offset by an increase in gross orders of
	$4.5&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	The age-outs of $50.9&nbsp;million for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 include $4.0&nbsp;million of age-ins which represent
	orders that previously aged-out but have been taken to revenue in the current period. There were no age-ins included in the age-out number for the year ended June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Cancellations were $11.6&nbsp;million and $4.1&nbsp;million in the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
	Cancellations are outside of our control and difficult to forecast; however, we continue to work closely with our customers to minimize the impact of cancellations on our&nbsp;business.
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Currency impacts resulted in a decrease in net orders of $16.3&nbsp;million in the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 compared to an
	increase of $0.1&nbsp;million in the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2014. This significant reduction is the result of having contracts based in several currencies such as Euro, Swiss Franc, and Japanese
	Yen. When the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar strengthens, such as it did in fiscal year 2015, the result is a negative impact on our backlog. Conversely, order backlog was increased due to foreign currency
	impacts by $0.1&nbsp;million in the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2014 due to minor currency fluctuations.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Currently,
	we expect age-outs in the first quarter of fiscal 2017 to be consistent with the age-outs experienced in the fourth fiscal quarter of 2016. Beginning in fiscal 2013, we made
	changes to our order taking process, including increased oversight responsibility for and management of distributors and changes in timing as to when we enter some of our distributor orders into
	backlog. We believe these changes will improve the quality of backlog over time and reduce the level of&nbsp;age-outs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	66
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Expressed
	as a percentage of total net revenue, except for product and services gross profits which are expressed as a percentage of related product and
	services revenue.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net revenue
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Product net revenue increased by $14.6&nbsp;million for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 as compared to the year ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2015. Product net revenue increased primarily due to a higher number of units sold and product mix, partially offset by $1.4&nbsp;million of foreign currency impacts due to the
	strengthening of the U.S Dollar mainly relative to the Euro. The number of units sold in fiscal 2016 increased by 13% as compared to fiscal 2015 for both the CyberKnife Systems and TomoTherapy
	Systems, the increase in net revenue was mainly driven by the increase of CyberKnife Systems recognized into revenue as these systems generally have a higher average selling price. This increase was
	partially offset by product revenue upgrades and other, which decreased by $3.7&nbsp;million in fiscal 2016. There were increases in upgrades related to CyberKnife Systems for the InCise MLC option;
	whereas, there was a decline in upgrade revenue related to TomoTherapy System due to the timing of customer upgrade&nbsp;cycles.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Services
	net revenue increased by $4.4&nbsp;million for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 as compared to the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. Additionally, the increase was
	attributable to an increase in training revenue because of the expiration and utilization of offered training; however, we do not expect training revenue from expired contracts to be at this volume
	going forward. There were also increases in installation revenue because of the increase in the units sold in fiscal 2016 as compared to prior year. This was partially offset by $3.4&nbsp;million of
	foreign currency impacts due to the strengthening of the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar mainly relative to the&nbsp;Euro.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	67
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Gross profit
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The overall gross profit margin for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 was 40% as compared to 38% for the year ended June&nbsp;30,
	2015, representing an increase of 2% due primarily to increased product sales volume and headcount related cost savings compared to the prior year. Product gross margin was 44% for the year ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2016 as compared to 42% for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, representing an increase of 2% because of the increased sales volume as well as some favorability in the costs of sales
	due to overhead absorption in fiscal 2016 being lower than in the prior
	year. Service gross margin for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 was 36% as compared to 35% for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, representing a slight increase of 1% due mainly to continued
	revenue growth from the increase in installed base and increased training revenue recognized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Research and development expenses
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Research and development expenses were $56.7&nbsp;million for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 as compared to $55.8&nbsp;million
	for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, which represents an increase of $0.9&nbsp;million, or 2%. The increase was primarily due to higher consulting fees associated with quality and validation
	testing for new products and an on-going development project that resulted in an increase of $3.9&nbsp;million compared to prior year. The increase in consulting expenses was partially offset by
	decreased compensation expenses of $2.3&nbsp;million driven by $1.2&nbsp;million in lower headcount related to terminations that were completed in the fourth quarter of the prior fiscal year as
	well as a $1.1&nbsp;million reduction in incentive-based and stock-based compensation expenses.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	anticipate that research and development expenses in fiscal 2017 will be down slightly compared with fiscal 2016 based on fewer consulting expenses to assist with the current schedule
	of our development projects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Selling and marketing expenses
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Selling and marketing expenses for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 were $56.8&nbsp;million as compared to $62.4&nbsp;million
	for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, which represents a decrease of $5.6&nbsp;million, or 9%. The decrease was partially attributable to a $4.4&nbsp;million decrease in compensation and
	compensation-related expenses, which consisted mainly of lower commission expense of $3.0&nbsp;million because of fewer sales in fiscal 2016 with high commission rates and a $1.5&nbsp;million
	decrease in salaries and benefits expenses because of decreased headcount, and a $0.3&nbsp;million decrease in share-based compensation expense mainly as a result of fewer grants of equity awards.
	These decreases were partially offset by an increase of $0.5&nbsp;million in severance-related expenses in the fourth quarter of fiscal year&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	anticipate selling and marketing expenses in fiscal 2017 will be slightly up compared with fiscal 2016 due to higher expenses related to new product launches and incremental
	headcount.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	68
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=68,EFW="2229520",CP="ACCURAY INCORPORATED",DN="1",CHK=909957,FOLIO='68',FILE='DISK123:[16ZBP1.16ZBP77301]DS77301A.;13',USER='ABEAULI',CD='22-AUG-2016;18:45' -->
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DS77301_1_69">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	General and administrative expenses
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;General and administrative expenses for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 were $50.1&nbsp;million as compared to
	$46.4&nbsp;million for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, which represents an increase of $3.7&nbsp;million, or 8%. This increase was primarily related to higher legal expenses of
	$3.0&nbsp;million due to ongoing defense of and response to legal matters, primarily related to the Cowealth Medical matter described in Note&nbsp;7 to&nbsp;the financial statements. In
	addition, there was an increase of $0.4&nbsp;million in severance-related expenses in the fourth quarter of fiscal year&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We
	anticipate general and administrative expenses in fiscal 2017 will be slightly down compared with fiscal 2016 due to decreased legal&nbsp;fees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Other expense, net
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Other expense, net for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 was $18.3&nbsp;million as compared to $18.6&nbsp;million for the year
	ended June&nbsp;30, 2015, which represents a decrease of $0.3&nbsp;million. This decrease was primarily attributable to an increase in other income of $1.2&nbsp;million because of a new
	licensing agreement in the third quarter of fiscal 2016. Foreign currency losses decreased by $0.5&nbsp;million, from $2.5&nbsp;million in fiscal 2015 to $2.0&nbsp;million in fiscal 2016,
	primarily because of the strengthening of the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar against the Euro and the appreciation of the Japanese Yen against the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar. In addition, there was an increase in
	interest income of $0.3&nbsp;million as compared to the prior year because of changes in the investment portfolio comprising of higher yield securities. The increases in the interest and other
	income and reduction in foreign exchange losses were partially offset by higher interest expenses of $0.9&nbsp;million, primarily the result of higher accretion of debt discount and amortization of
	debt offering costs as compared to fiscal 2015 on the 3.75% Convertible Notes, the 3.50% Convertible Notes, the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes and the Secured Term Loan. Additionally,
	$1.0&nbsp;million of non-cash debt extinguishment loss was incurred in fiscal 2016 because of the extinguishment of $63.4&nbsp;million of the 3.75% Convertible Notes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Provision for income taxes
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The provision for income taxes was lower in fiscal 2016 compared to fiscal 2015 mainly due to the activities in international
	locations&#151;reduction of benefits related to uncertain tax positions and decreased foreign earnings.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	June&nbsp;30, 2016, we had federal and state net operating loss carryforwards of $325.3&nbsp;million and $145.6&nbsp;million, respectively. These federal and state net operating
	loss carryforwards are available to offset future taxable income, if any, in varying amounts and will begin to expire in 2019 for federal and 2017 for state purposes, respectively. Such net operating
	loss carryforwards include tax benefits from employee stock option exercises in excess of the share-based compensation expense that has been recognized for these awards. We will record approximately
	$3.8&nbsp;million as a credit to additional paid-in capital if and when such excess benefits are ultimately realized. We also had federal and state research and development tax credit carryforwards
	of approximately $17.9&nbsp;million and $17.6&nbsp;million, respectively. If not utilized, the federal research credits will begin to expire in 2019, the California research credits have no
	expiration date and the other state research credits begin to expire in 2017. Realization of the deferred tax assets, among other factors, is dependent on our ability to generate sufficient taxable
	income prior to the expiration of the carryforwards. Because of the inconsistent history of net operating income as adjusted for permanent differences, we cannot conclude that the net domestic
	deferred tax assets will more likely than not be realized. Accordingly, we have recorded a full valuation allowance against our domestic net deferred tax&nbsp;assets.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At
	June&nbsp;30, 2016, there was no provision for U.S.&nbsp;income tax for undistributed earnings of our foreign subsidiaries as it is currently our intention to reinvest these
	earnings indefinitely in operations outside the U.S.&nbsp;The cumulative amount of such undistributed earnings upon which no U.S.&nbsp;income tax
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	69
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_DS77301_1_70">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	has
	been provided as of June&nbsp;30, 2016 was $22.4&nbsp;million. If repatriated, these earnings could result in a tax expense at the current U.S.&nbsp;Federal statutory tax rate of 35%,
	subject to available net operating losses and other factors. Subject to limitation, tax on undistributed earnings may also be reduced by foreign tax credits that may be generated in connection with
	the repatriation of&nbsp;earnings.
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT>
</FONT>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0PT;FONT-SIZE:1.5PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;BORDER-BOTTOM:SOLID #000000 1.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_LINERULETXT,NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT" -->
<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(a)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Expressed
	as a percentage of total net revenue, except for product and services gross profits which are expressed as a percentage of related product and
	services revenue.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Net revenue
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Product net revenue increased by $5.1&nbsp;million for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 as compared to the year ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2014. Product net revenue increased primarily due to a higher number of units sold and product mix, partially offset by $7.5&nbsp;million of foreign currency impacts due to the
	strengthening of the U.S Dollar. The number of units sold in fiscal 2015 increased by 4% as compared to fiscal 2014 driven by an increase in the number of CyberKnife Systems recognized into revenue,
	which was partially offset by a decrease in the number of TomoTherapy Systems recognized into revenue; however, as the CyberKnife Systems generally have a higher average selling price, the overall net
	product revenue increased. In addition, product revenue upgrades increased by $3.0&nbsp;million in fiscal&nbsp;2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Services
	net revenue increased by $5.3&nbsp;million for the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2015 as compared to the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2014. The increase of $5.3&nbsp;million was
	attributable to a net increase in our installed base and customer conversion to higher priced maintenance contracts (particularly the TomoTherapy Systems). This was partially offset by
	$6.7&nbsp;million of foreign currency impacts due to the strengthening of the U.S.&nbsp;Dollar.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	70
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
