<HR NOSHADE COLOR="#000000" SIZE="1.0PT" WIDTH="26%" ALIGN="LEFT">
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	These
	amounts represent principal and interest cash payments over the contractual life of the debt obligations, including anticipated interest payments that
	are not recorded on the Company's consolidated balance sheet. Any conversion, premium, redemption or purchase of Convertible Notes would impact cash payments noted in the preceding table.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company enters into standard indemnification agreements with its landlords and all superior mortgagees and their respective directors, officers' agents, and employees in the ordinary
	course of business. Pursuant to these agreements, the Company will indemnify, hold harmless, and agree to reimburse the indemnified party for losses suffered or incurred by the indemnified party,
	generally the landlords, in connection with any loss, accident, injury, or damage by any third-party with respect to the leased facilities. The term of these indemnification agreements is from the
	commencement of the lease agreements until termination of the lease agreements. The maximum potential amount of future payments the Company could be required to make under these indemnification
	agreements is unlimited; however, historically the Company has not incurred claims or costs to defend lawsuits or
	settle claims related to these indemnification agreements. The Company has not recorded any liability associated with its indemnification agreements as it is not aware of any pending or threatened
	actions that represent probable losses as of June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Royalty Agreement
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company has an exclusive license agreement with the Wisconsin Alumni Research Foundation (WARF), to make, use, sell and otherwise
	distribute products under certain of WARF's patents anywhere in the world. The Company is required to pay WARF a royalty for each TomoTherapy System sold that includes the licensed technology. The
	license agreement expires upon expiration of the patents and may be terminated earlier if the Company so elects. WARF has the right to terminate the license agreement if the Company does not meet the
	minimum royalty obligation of $0.3&nbsp;million per year, or if the Company commits any breach of the license agreement's covenants. The Company recorded royalty costs of $0.6&nbsp;million,
	$0.6&nbsp;million and $0.7&nbsp;million for the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively, which were recorded in cost of revenue or deferred cost of revenue. The Company had
	accrued liabilities of approximately $0.1&nbsp;million and $0.2&nbsp;million at June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015, respectively, related to this&nbsp;agreement.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	109
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=6,SEQ=109,EFW="2229520",CP="ACCURAY INCORPORATED",DN="1",CHK=109802,FOLIO='109',FILE='DISK123:[16ZBP1.16ZBP77301]FQ77301A.;16',USER='BKYNARD',CD='24-AUG-2016;11:09' -->
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FQ77301_1_110">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Accuray Incorporated
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	7. Commitments and Contingencies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Software License Indemnity
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the terms of the Company's software license agreements with its customers, the Company agrees that in the event the software sold
	infringes upon any patent, copyright, trademark, or any other proprietary right of a third-party, it will indemnify its customer licensees against any loss, expense, or liability from any damages that
	may be awarded against its customer. The Company includes this infringement indemnification in all of its software license agreements and selected managed services arrangements. In the event the
	customer cannot use the software or service due to infringement and the Company cannot obtain the right to use, replace or modify the license or service in a commercially feasible manner so that it no
	longer infringes, then the Company may terminate the license and provide the customer a refund of the fees paid by the customer for the infringing license or service. The Company has not recorded any
	liability associated with this indemnification, as it is not aware of any pending or threatened actions that represent probable losses as of June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Litigation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;From time to time, the Company is involved in legal proceedings arising in the ordinary course of its business. The Company records a
	provision for a loss when it believes that it is both probable that a loss has been incurred and the amount can be reasonably estimated. Currently, management believes the Company does not have any
	probable and estimable losses related to any current legal proceedings and claims. Although occasional adverse decisions or settlements may occur, except as described in the matters below, management
	does not believe that an adverse determination with respect to any of these claims would individually or in the aggregate materially and adversely affect the Company's financial condition or operating
	results. For certain legal proceedings, management believes that there is a reasonable possibility that material losses may be incurred; however, the Company is unable to reasonably estimate a range
	of reasonably possible losses with respect to these matters. Litigation is inherently unpredictable and is subject to significant uncertainties, some of which are beyond the Company's control. Should
	any of these estimates and assumptions change or prove to have been incorrect, the Company could incur significant charges related to legal matters that could have a material impact on its results of
	operations, financial position and cash&nbsp;flows.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Rotary Systems
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On April&nbsp;28, 2011, a former supplier to TomoTherapy, Rotary Systems Incorporated ("Rotary Systems"), filed suit in Minnesota
	state court, Tenth Judicial District, Anoka County, against TomoTherapy alleging misappropriation of trade secrets, as well as several other counts alleging various theories of injury. Rotary Systems
	alleges TomoTherapy misappropriated Rotary Systems' trade secrets pertaining to a component previously purchased from Rotary Systems, which TomoTherapy now purchases from a different supplier. The
	suit alleges TomoTherapy improperly supplied the alleged trade secrets to its present supplier, Dynamic Sealing Technologies&nbsp;Inc. (also a named defendant in the suit). Rotary Systems has made
	an unspecified claim for damages of greater than $50,000. TomoTherapy moved to dismiss the case and, on August&nbsp;29, 2011, the court granted the motion to dismiss with respect to all counts other
	than the count alleging misappropriation of trade secrets. On May&nbsp;21, 2012, the court gave Rotary Systems sixty days to identify the alleged trade secrets with specificity or face dismissal of
	its claim with prejudice. The court held a hearing on September&nbsp;20, 2012 to review Rotary Systems' amended complaint. TomoTherapy filed a motion for summary judgment on the trade secret claim,
	the court ruled in favor of TomoTherapy on December&nbsp;5, 2013, and Rotary
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	110
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=110,EFW="2229520",CP="ACCURAY INCORPORATED",DN="1",CHK=177328,FOLIO='110',FILE='DISK123:[16ZBP1.16ZBP77301]FQ77301A.;16',USER='BKYNARD',CD='24-AUG-2016;11:09' -->
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FQ77301_1_111">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Accuray Incorporated
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	7. Commitments and Contingencies (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Systems
	appealed. On December&nbsp;22, 2014, the Minnesota Court of Appeals reversed the district court's dismissal of Rotary Systems' trade secrets claim and remanded it to the district court but
	affirmed the dismissal of Rotary Systems' other claims. In late October&nbsp;2015, a final scheduling order was confirmed for the remanded claims and the parties are currently in the process of
	conducting discovery. On April&nbsp;19, 2016, the parties entered into a written settlement agreement resolving the lawsuit. A stipulation of dismissal dismissing all claims by all parties with
	prejudice was filed with the court and the court entered an order on July&nbsp;12, 2016 dismissing the case with&nbsp;prejudice.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Cowealth Medical
</I>
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On February&nbsp;27, 2014, Cowealth Medical Holding&nbsp;Co.,&nbsp;Ltd. ("Cowealth"), Accuray's former distributor in China,
	submitted a request for binding arbitration with the International Chamber of Commerce International Court of Arbitration ("ICC") alleging, among other matters, that Accuray breached its distributor
	agreement with Cowealth by wrongfully terminating Cowealth as its distributor and misappropriated certain of Cowealth's confidential information. Cowealth was seeking damages of approximately
	$170.0&nbsp;million and injunctive relief. Accuray filed counterclaims for damages of approximately $35.0&nbsp;million. Accuray's answer and counterclaim were submitted to the ICC on
	May&nbsp;12, 2014, and Cowealth served its reply on June&nbsp;27, 2014. A hearing was held in Hong Kong between January&nbsp;26, 2015 and February&nbsp;6, 2015. The parties filed closing
	submissions and reply closing submissions in March&nbsp;2015. On October&nbsp;29, 2015, the ICC ruled that Accuray was liable for certain damages and awarded Cowealth approximately
	$3.4&nbsp;million. On November&nbsp;27, 2015, Cowealth applied for a correction to the award to revise the amount of damages upwards to approximately $5.5&nbsp;million. On January&nbsp;21,
	2016, the arbitrator granted Cowealth's application for a correction on the grounds that the original award amount was a clerical error on the part of the arbitrator. Interest on the final award
	amount will accrue at a rate of 5% per annum starting 30&nbsp;days after the date the corrected award was issued until payment. Accordingly, management recorded a charge of $3.4&nbsp;million for
	the first fiscal quarter ending September&nbsp;30, 2015, and an additional $2.1&nbsp;million for the second fiscal quarter ending December&nbsp;30, 2015. The parties filed cost submissions and
	reply cost submissions in December&nbsp;2015. The ICC released the final award on February&nbsp;12, 2016, which dealt with the parties' claims for costs of the arbitration. Under the final award,
	the arbitrator awarded costs to Cowealth at a net amount of $2.4&nbsp;million and rejected all other claims and requests. Prior to the ruling of the ICC, no accrual was established in the Company's
	consolidated financial statements because management did not believe the likelihood of an award of damages or costs of arbitration to Cowealth were probable or estimable. In addition, the Company won
	several of its counterclaims including the right to be assigned the existing service contracts between Cowealth and Accuray customers, transfer to Accuray any regulatory clearances, licenses or
	permits obtained and held for the purposes of selling the CyberKnife System in China and deliver any consigned parts in their possession.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	8. Stockholders' Equity
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;At June&nbsp;30, 2016, the Company had 13.2&nbsp;million shares of common stock reserved for future issuance to the holders of the 3.50% Convertible Senior Notes and had
	8.8&nbsp;million shares of common stock reserved for issuance under the stock incentive plans and the employee stock purchase&nbsp;plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	111
</FONT>
</P>

</A>

<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Accuray Incorporated
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	9. Stock Incentive Plan and Employee Stock Purchase Plan
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As of June&nbsp;30, 2016, the Company had two outstanding stock incentive plans: the 2007 Stock Incentive Plan, or the 2007 Plan; and the 1998 Stock Incentive Plan, or the1998 Plan.
	The 2007 Plan permits the granting of stock options, restricted stock awards, or RSAs and restricted stock units, or RSUs. The vesting of RSUs under the 2007 Plan may be time-based (over the requisite
	service period), performance-based, or PSUs or market-based, or MSUs. Only employees of the Company are eligible to receive incentive stock options. Non-employees may be granted non-qualified
	stock&nbsp;options.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Stock
	options granted under the 2007 Plan have an exercise price of at least 100% of the fair market value of the underlying stock on the grant date and no less than 85% of the fair
	value for non-qualified stock options. The stock options have 10&nbsp;year contractual terms and generally become exercisable for 25% of the option shares one year from the date of grant and then
	ratably over the following 36&nbsp;months. Time-based RSUs generally vest 25% of the share units covered by the grant on each of the first through fourth anniversaries of the date of the grant.
	However, certain of the outstanding RSUs vest 50% upon the first anniversary year of the grant date, and 50% upon the second anniversary year of the grant date. The Board of Directors has the
	discretion to use different vesting schedules.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of June&nbsp;30, 2016, the 1998 Plan continued to remain in effect; however, the Company can no longer grant equity awards under the&nbsp;plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	following table summarizes the share-based compensation charges included in the Company's consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive&nbsp;loss:
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	amount of capitalized share-based compensation costs as components of inventory for the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015 was insignificant. For the year ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2014, the Company capitalized share-based compensation costs of $0.5&nbsp;million, as components of&nbsp;inventory.
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>

	Stock Options
</I>
</B>
</FONT>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company did not grant any stock options in the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>

<!-- END OF USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	aggregate intrinsic value in the table above represents the total pre-tax intrinsic value (the&nbsp;difference between the fair value of the Company's common stock on
	June&nbsp;30, 2016 of $5.19 and the exercise price of the options) that would have been received by option holders if all options exercisable had been exercised on June&nbsp;30, 2016. The total
	intrinsic value of options exercised in the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014 was approximately $0.1&nbsp;million, $1.4&nbsp;million and $3.8&nbsp;million, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
	the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, the Company recognized $0.8&nbsp;million, $1.1&nbsp;million and $1.7&nbsp;million, respectively, of share-based
	compensation expense for stock options granted to&nbsp;employees.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Tax
	benefits from tax deductions for exercised options and disqualifying dispositions in excess of the deferred tax asset attributable to stock compensation costs for such options are
	credited to additional paid-in capital. Realized excess tax benefits related to stock options exercises was zero for each of the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and&nbsp;2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of June&nbsp;30, 2016, there was approximately $0.1&nbsp;million of unrecognized compensation cost, net of estimated forfeitures, related to unvested stock options, which is
	expected to be recognized over a weighted average period of 0.47&nbsp;years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	113
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>

	Restricted Stock

	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The following table summarizes the activity of RSUs, PSUs and MSUs:
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:67%;MARGIN-LEFT:10%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"120%" -->
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of June&nbsp;30, 2016, there was approximately $20.4&nbsp;million of unrecognized compensation cost, net of estimated forfeitures, related to restricted stock, which is expected
	to be recognized over a weighted average period of 2.28&nbsp;years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	114
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=114,EFW="2229520",CP="ACCURAY INCORPORATED",DN="1",CHK=162063,FOLIO='114',FILE='DISK123:[16ZBP1.16ZBP77301]FS77301A.;16',USER='BKYNARD',CD='24-AUG-2016;11:10' -->
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FS77301_1_115">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Accuray Incorporated
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	9. Stock Incentive Plan and Employee Stock Purchase Plan (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Restricted Stock Units
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company recognized $7.6&nbsp;million, $7.9&nbsp;million and $6.4&nbsp;million of share-based compensation expense, net of
	estimated forfeitures, related to RSUs during the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014. The weighted average grant date fair value per share of RSUs was $6.01, $6.79 and $7.32 for the years
	ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. As of June&nbsp;30, 2016, there was approximately $17.7&nbsp;million of unrecognized compensation cost, net of estimated forfeitures,
	related to RSUs. The aggregate fair market value of RSUs that vested during the year ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 was $7.6&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Performance Stock Units
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During fiscal 2012, the Compensation Committee approved the grant of 1.0&nbsp;million PSUs to certain employees of the Company. The
	PSUs were cancelled in fiscal 2014 as it was determined that the Company did not achieve the requisite performance targets. The Compensation Committee approved the grant of zero, 20,000 and
	70,000&nbsp;PSUs to select employees of the Company in the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Of these PSUs, 20,000, 25,000 and 25,000&nbsp;vested in the years ended
	June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively, due to the achievement of the requisite performance targets while zero, zero and 38,000&nbsp;were cancelled in the years ended June&nbsp;30,
	2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company recognized $0.04&nbsp;million, 0.2&nbsp;million, and $0.1&nbsp;million of share-based compensation expense, net of estimated forfeitures, related to PSUs during the
	years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015, and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Market Stock Units
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Compensation Committee approved the performance equity program, referred to as the market stock unit program, or MSU program, in
	October&nbsp;2012. The Company's MSU Program uses the Russell 2000 index as a performance benchmark and requires that the Company's total stockholder return match or exceed that of the Russell 2000.
	Based on a sliding scale of how much the Company's total stockholder return outperforms the Russell 2000 benchmark, the participating executives can earn up to a maximum of 150% of the target number
	of shares over two
	measurement periods. The Company uses a Monte-Carlo simulation to calculate the fair value of the award on the grant date. The Compensation Committee approved the grant of 0.6&nbsp;million,
	0.5&nbsp;million and 0.7&nbsp;million MSUs to select employees of the Company in the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Of these MSUs, 0.4&nbsp;million,
	0.5&nbsp;million and zero vested in the years ending June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively, due to the Company's total stockholder return performance against the Russell 2000 index while
	0.1&nbsp;million, 0.2&nbsp;million and 0.3&nbsp;million MSUs were cancelled in the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. Assuming 100% performance target will be
	achieved, 0.2&nbsp;million and 0.3&nbsp;million of MSUs will vest by the end of fiscal 2017 and 2018, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company recognized $3.0&nbsp;million, $3.4&nbsp;million and $1.8&nbsp;million of share-based compensation expense, net of estimated forfeitures, related to MSUs during the
	years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. The weighted average grant date fair value per share of MSUs was $6.61, $6.64 and $7.18 for the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015
	and 2014, respectively. As of June&nbsp;30, 2016, there was approximately $2.8&nbsp;million of unrecognized compensation cost, net of estimated forfeitures, related to&nbsp;MSUs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	115
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Accuray Incorporated
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	9. Stock Incentive Plan and Employee Stock Purchase Plan (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Employee Stock Purchase Plan
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under the Company's 2007 Employee Stock Purchase Plan, or ESPP, qualified employees are permitted to purchase the Company's common
	stock at 85% of the lower of the fair market value of the common stock on the commencement date of each offering period or the fair market value on the specified purchase date. The ESPP is deemed
	compensatory and compensation costs are accounted for under ASC 718,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Stock Compensation
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	. Employees' payroll deductions may not exceed 10% of their
	salaries. Employees may purchase up to 2,500&nbsp;shares per period provided that the value of the shares purchased in any calendar year may not exceed $25,000, as calculated pursuant to the
	purchase&nbsp;plan.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company estimates the fair value of ESPP shares at the date of grant using the Black-Scholes option pricing model. The weighted average assumptions were as&nbsp;follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_38"></A>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	risk-free rate for the expected term of the ESPP option was based on the U.S.&nbsp;Treasury Constant Maturity rate for each offering period; expected volatility was based on the
	historical volatility of the Company's common stock; and the expected term was based upon the offering period of the ESPP. For the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, the Company
	recognized $1.3&nbsp;million, $1.3&nbsp;million and $1.3&nbsp;million, respectively, of compensation expense related to its&nbsp;ESPP.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company issued 0.7&nbsp;million shares under the ESPP in fiscal 2016 and 2015, respectively, at a weighted average price per share of $4.92 and $5.61, respectively. As of
	June&nbsp;30, 2016, total unrecognized compensation cost related to the ESPP plan was $0.6&nbsp;million, which the Company expects to recognize over a weighted average period of 0.6&nbsp;years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">

</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Income
	tax payable was $2.3&nbsp;million, $0.4&nbsp;million and $2.0&nbsp;million at June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively. A reconciliation of income taxes at the
	statutory federal income tax rate to the provision for income taxes included in the accompanying consolidated statements of operations and comprehensive loss is as&nbsp;follows:

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_42"></A>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Accuray Incorporated
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	10. Income Taxes (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Deferred
	income taxes reflect the net tax effects of temporary differences between the carrying amounts of assets and liabilities for financial reporting purposes and the amounts used
	for income tax purposes. Significant components of the Company's net deferred tax assets were as&nbsp;follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;WIDTH:70%;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</FONT>
</P>
<!-- COMMAND=ADD_TABLEWIDTH,"100%" -->
<!-- USER-SPECIFIED TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER">

</TD>
<TD WIDTH="56PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="7PT" ALIGN="RIGHT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="56PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="12PT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
</TD>
<!-- TABLE COLUMN WIDTHS END -->
</TR>

<TH ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

</TH>

<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;

	June&nbsp;30,

</FONT>
</TH>

<FONT SIZE=1>
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</TH>
</TR>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company has not provided for U.S.&nbsp;income taxes on undistributed earnings of its foreign subsidiaries because it intends to permanently re-invest these earnings outside the
	U.S.&nbsp;The cumulative amount of such undistributed earnings upon which no U.S.&nbsp;income taxes have been provided as of June&nbsp;30, 2016 was $22.4&nbsp;million. It is not practicable to
	determine the income tax liability that might be incurred if these earnings were to be repatriated to the&nbsp;U.S.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of June&nbsp;30, 2016 the Company had approximately $325.3&nbsp;million and $145.6&nbsp;million in federal and state net operating loss carryforwards, respectively. The federal
	and state carryforwards expire in varying amounts beginning in 2019 for federal and 2017 for state purposes. Such net operating loss carryforwards include excess tax benefits from employee stock
	option exercises which, in accordance with guidance for income tax accounting, have not been recorded within the Company's deferred tax asset balances. The Company will record approximately
	$3.8&nbsp;million as a credit to additional paid-in capital as and when such excess benefits are ultimately realized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	addition, as of June&nbsp;30, 2016, the Company had federal and state research and development tax credits of approximately $17.9&nbsp;million and $17.6&nbsp;million,
	respectively. The federal research credits will begin to expire in 2019, the California research credits have no expiration date, and the other state research credits began to expire in&nbsp;2017.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Under
	the Internal Revenue Code ("IRC") Sections&nbsp;382 and&nbsp;383, annual use of our net operating loss and research tax credit carryforwards to offset taxable income may be
	limited based on cumulative
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	118
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
	changes
	in ownership. An analysis of the impact of this provision through March&nbsp;31, 2016 has been performed and it was determined that, although ownership changes had occurred, the carryovers
	should be available for utilization by the Company before they expire, provided we generate sufficient future taxable&nbsp;income.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based
	on the available objective evidence and history of losses, the Company has established a 100% valuation allowance against the combined domestic net deferred tax assets of Accuray
	and TomoTherapy because of uncertainty surrounding the realization of such deferred tax&nbsp;assets.
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	calculation of unrecognized tax benefits involves dealing with uncertainties in the application of complex global tax regulations. Management regularly assesses the Company's tax
	positions in respect to legislative, bilateral tax treaty, regulatory and judicial developments in the countries in which the Company does business. The reduction in prior year's tax positions
	primarily relates to lapses of applicable statutes of limitations. The Company anticipates that except for $1.6&nbsp;million in uncertain tax positions that may be reduced related to the lapse of
	various statutes of limitation and completion of tax examinations. There will be no material changes in uncertain tax positions in the next 12&nbsp;months. As of June&nbsp;30, 2016, the amount of
	gross unrecognized tax benefits was $16.6&nbsp;million of which $11.2&nbsp;million would affect the Company's effective tax rate if&nbsp;realized.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company's practice is to recognize interest and/or penalties related to income tax matters in income tax expense. As of June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015, the Company had approximately
	$0.5&nbsp;million and $0.9&nbsp;million, respectively, of accrued interest and penalties related to uncertain tax&nbsp;positions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company files income tax returns in the United&nbsp;States federal, various states and foreign jurisdictions. Due to attributes being carried forward and utilized during open
	years, the statute of limitations remains open for the U.S.&nbsp;federal jurisdiction and domestic states for tax years from 1999 and forward. The material foreign jurisdictions are France,
	Switzerland, and Japan, whose tax years remain open from 2012, 2011, and 2010, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company is also subject to periodic examination of its income tax returns by the Internal Revenue Service (IRS) and other tax authorities, and in some cases the Company has received
	additional tax assessments which have not been significant. During fiscal year 2016, the German tax authorities completed their audit on the Company's 2010 to 2013 tax returns with no significant
	adjustments. In addition, the Company has been audited by the Swiss Federal Tax Administration for the period 2011 through 2015 and the Company does not expect a significant impact on its results
	of&nbsp;operations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	119
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="LINE-HEIGHT:0.75PT;FONT-SIZE:0.75PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
</FONT>
	&#8203;
<FONT>
</FONT>
</TD>

<DIV STYLE="PADDING:0PT;POSITION:RELATIVE;TEXT-ALIGN:LEFT;MARGIN-LEFT:15%;">
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	(1)
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Other
	income consists of interest income, investment gains and losses, and other miscellaneous income.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Debt
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	First Lien Senior Secured Term Loan due January&nbsp;2021 (Secured Loan)
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On January&nbsp;11, 2016, the Company closed a $70.0&nbsp;million first lien senior secured debt financing agreement with Cerberus
	Business Finance,&nbsp;LLC, an affiliate of Cerberus Capital Management, L.P (the&nbsp;"Secured Loan"). The proceeds of the loan are to be used to retire the 3.75% Convertible Notes at the earlier
	of August&nbsp;2016 or when otherwise redeemed. The Secured Loan bears interest at a variable rate per annum equal to, at the Company's option, (i)&nbsp;the LIBOR Rate for one month plus an
	applicable margin of 7.00% (subject to a LIBOR Rate floor of 1.00% per annum), or (ii)&nbsp;a Reference Rate, which is the higher of 1)&nbsp;3.25%, 2)&nbsp;Federal Funds Rate plus 0.5%,
	3)&nbsp;the LIBOR rate for 1&nbsp;month plus 1%, and 4)&nbsp;the US Prime Rate as published in the Wall Street Journal, plus an applicable margin of 4.75% per annum. The loan is repayable in
	consecutive quarterly installments of $875,000 with the final payment due on the final maturity date. The Secured Loan matures on the earlier of: (i)&nbsp;January&nbsp;11, 2021 and (ii)&nbsp;the
	date that is 120&nbsp;days prior to the scheduled maturity date of the 3.5% Convertible Notes maturing February&nbsp;1, 2018 unless the Company has set aside specifically identifiable funds raised
	from new common equity or new debt equal to the then-outstanding principal amount of the 3.5% Convertible Notes. The net proceeds from the offering, after deducting the initial purchaser's discount
	and commission and the related offering costs, were approximately $65.5&nbsp;million. The offering costs of $3.1&nbsp;million and the initial purchaser's discount and commission of
	$1.4&nbsp;million (both of which are recorded in Long-term Debt) are being amortized to interest expense using the effective interest method over five years. The Secured Loan is secured by
	first-priority liens on substantially all the assets of the&nbsp;Company.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	covenants in the Secured Loan include:
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Secured leverage&#151;defines the maximum amount of secured leverage that can be on the Company's books at a given point in
	time calculated by the total secured debt divided by the last twelve months' adjusted EBITDA;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Total leverage&#151;defines the maximum amount of total leverage that can be on the Company's books at a given point in time
	calculated by the total debt divided by the last twelve months' adjusted EBITDA;
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	120
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=120,EFW="2229520",CP="ACCURAY INCORPORATED",DN="1",CHK=85288,FOLIO='120',FILE='DISK123:[16ZBP1.16ZBP77301]FU77301A.;9',USER='ABEAULI',CD='22-AUG-2016;18:45' -->
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FU77301_1_121">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Accuray Incorporated
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Debt (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<UL>
<DL COMPACT>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Fixed Charge Coverage Ratio&#151;designed to ensure that the Company's cash fixed charges are met with adequate free cash flow
	based on a minimum coverage ratio to be set and&nbsp;maintained;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Minimum EBITDA&#151;defines the minimum amount of adjusted EBITDA the Company must maintain and&nbsp;generate;
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Maximum CapEx&#151;defines how much cash the Company can use annually to pursue capital projects, purchase PP&amp;E and other
	related activities during the life of the loan;&nbsp;and
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<BR>
<BR>
</FONT>
</DD>
<DT STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;MARGIN-BOTTOM:-11PT;'>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&#149;
</FONT>
</DT>
<DD STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Affirmative and negative covenants&#151;defines reporting requirements, subsidiary asset restrictions, dividend distribution
	and repayment requirements among other general requirements.
</FONT>
</DD>
</DL>
</UL>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	Company may, at its election, repay the Secured Loan at any time and if so, the Company will be required to pay a prepayment premium of 2% if the Secured Loan is repaid or
	accelerated within the first year on the amount repaid and 1% if the Secured Loan is repaid or accelerated within the second year on the amount&nbsp;repaid.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	3.75% Convertible Senior Notes due August&nbsp;2016
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On August&nbsp;1, 2011, the Company issued the 3.75% Convertible Notes to certain qualified institutional buyers or QIBs. The 3.75%
	Convertible Notes were offered and sold to the QIBs pursuant to Rule&nbsp;144A under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended or Rule&nbsp;144A. The net proceeds from the $100&nbsp;million
	offering, after deducting the initial purchaser's discount and commission and the related offering costs, were approximately $96.1&nbsp;million. The offering costs and the initial purchaser's
	discount and commission (which are recorded in Other Assets) are both being amortized to interest expense using the effective interest method over five years. The 3.75% Convertible Notes bear interest
	at a rate of 3.75% per year, payable semi-annually in arrears in cash on February&nbsp;1 and August&nbsp;1 of each year, beginning on February&nbsp;1, 2012. The 3.75% Convertible Notes will
	mature on August&nbsp;1, 2016, unless earlier repurchased, redeemed or&nbsp;converted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	3.75% Convertible Notes were issued under an Indenture between the Company and The Bank of New&nbsp;York Mellon Trust Company, N.A., as trustee. Holders of the 3.75% Convertible
	Notes may convert their 3.75% Convertible Notes at any time on or after May&nbsp;1, 2016 until the close of business on the business day immediately preceding the maturity date. Prior to
	May&nbsp;1, 2016, holders of the 3.75% Convertible Notes may convert their 3.75% Convertible Notes only under the following circumstances: (1)&nbsp;during any calendar quarter after the calendar
	quarter ending September&nbsp;30, 2011, and only during such calendar quarter, if the closing sale price of the Company's common stock for each of 20 or more trading days in the
	30&nbsp;consecutive trading days ending on the last trading day of the immediately preceding calendar quarter exceeds 130% of the conversion price in effect on the last trading day of the
	immediately preceding calendar quarter; (2)&nbsp;during the five consecutive business days immediately after any five consecutive trading-day period (such five consecutive trading-day period, the
	"Note Measurement Period") in which the trading price per $1,000 principal amount of 3.75% Convertible Notes for each trading day of that Note Measurement Period was equal to or less than 98% of the
	product of the closing sale price of shares of the Company's common stock and the applicable conversion rate for such trading day; (3)&nbsp;if the Company calls any or all of the 3.75% Convertible
	Notes for redemption, at any time prior to the close of business on the business day immediately preceding the redemption date; or (4)&nbsp;upon the occurrence of specified corporate transactions as
	described in the Indenture. Upon conversion by holders of the 3.75% Convertible
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	121
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=121,EFW="2229520",CP="ACCURAY INCORPORATED",DN="1",CHK=310613,FOLIO='121',FILE='DISK123:[16ZBP1.16ZBP77301]FU77301A.;9',USER='ABEAULI',CD='22-AUG-2016;18:45' -->
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FU77301_1_122">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Accuray Incorporated
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Debt (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	Notes,
	the Company will have the right to pay or deliver, as the case may be, cash, shares of common stock of the Company or a combination thereof, at the Company's election. At any time on or prior
	to the 33rd&nbsp;business day immediately preceding the maturity date, the Company may irrevocably elect to (a)&nbsp;deliver solely shares of common stock of the Company in respect of the
	Company's conversion obligation or (b)&nbsp;pay cash up to the aggregate principal amount of the 3.75% Convertible Notes to be converted and pay or deliver, as the case may be, cash, shares of
	common stock of the Company or a combination thereof in respect of the remainder, if any, of the Company's conversion obligation in excess of the aggregate principal amount of the 3.75% Convertible
	Notes being converted. The initial conversion rate is 105.5548&nbsp;shares of the Company's common stock per $1,000 principal amount of 3.75% Convertible Notes (which represents an initial
	conversion price of approximately $9.47 per share of the Company's common stock). The conversion rate, and thus the conversion price, is subject to adjustment as further described below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Holders
	of the 3.75% Convertible Notes who convert their 3.75% Convertible Notes in connection with a "make-whole fundamental change," as defined in the Indenture, may be entitled to a
	make-whole premium in the form of an increase in the conversion rate. Additionally, in the event of a "fundamental change," as defined in the Indenture, holders of the 3.75% Convertible Notes may
	require the Company to purchase all or a portion of their 3.75% Convertible Notes at a fundamental change repurchase price equal to 100% of the principal amount of 3.75% Convertible Notes, plus
	accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to, but not including, the fundamental change repurchase&nbsp;date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior
	to the maturity date, the Company may redeem for cash all or a portion of the 3.75% Convertible Notes if the closing sale price of its common stock exceeds 130% of the applicable
	conversion price (the&nbsp;initial conversion price is approximately $9.47 per share of common stock) of such 3.75% Convertible Notes for at least 20&nbsp;trading days during any consecutive
	30&nbsp;trading-day period (including the last trading day of such&nbsp;period).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	accordance with ASC 470-20, the Company separately accounts for the liability and equity conversion components of the 3.75% Convertible Notes. The principal amount of the liability
	component of the 3.75% Convertible Notes was $75.9&nbsp;million as of the date of issuance based on the present value of its cash flows using a discount rate of 10%, our approximate borrowing rate
	at the date of the issuance for a similar debt instrument without the conversion feature. The carrying value of the equity conversion component was $24.1&nbsp;million. A portion of the initial
	purchaser's discount and commission and the offering costs totaling $0.9&nbsp;million was allocated to the equity conversion component. The liability component is being accreted to the principal
	amount of the 3.75% Convertible Notes using the effective interest method over five&nbsp;years.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	January&nbsp;2016, the Company repurchased approximately $63.4&nbsp;million in aggregate principal amount of its 3.75% Convertible Senior Notes due August&nbsp;2016 for
	$66.6&nbsp;million in cash. As $63.4&nbsp;million of the 3.75% Convertible Senior Notes were settled in cash, a total of 6.7&nbsp;million potentially dilutive shares are no longer potentially
	outstanding from a net loss per share perspective, these shares were already noted
	in Note&nbsp;2 above as being excluded due to being anti-dilutive in the current fiscal year of 2016. The Company recorded a charge in the third quarter of fiscal 2016 of approximately
	$1.0&nbsp;million associated with the repurchase of the notes. Following such transactions, approximately $36.6&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of the 3.75% Convertible Notes remained
	outstanding. See Note&nbsp;18
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Subsequent Event
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	regarding the retirement of the remaining 3.75% Convertible Notes.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	122
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FU77301_1_123">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Accuray Incorporated
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Debt (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	3.50% Convertible Senior Notes due February&nbsp;2018
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In February&nbsp;2013, the Company issued $115.0&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of its 3.50% Convertible Notes to certain
	QIBs. The 3.50% Convertible Notes were offered and sold to the QIBs pursuant to Rule&nbsp;144A. The net proceeds from the offering, after deducting the initial purchaser's discount and commission
	and the related offering costs, were approximately $110.5&nbsp;million. The offering costs and the initial purchaser's discount and commission (which are recorded in Other Assets) are both being
	amortized to interest expense using the effective interest method over five years. The 3.50% Convertible Notes bear interest at a rate of 3.50% per year, payable semi-annually in arrears in cash on
	February&nbsp;1 and August&nbsp;1 of each year, which began on August&nbsp;1, 2013. The 3.50% Convertible Notes will mature on February&nbsp;1, 2018, unless earlier repurchased, redeemed
	or&nbsp;converted.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	April&nbsp;2014, through a series of transactions, the Company refinanced approximately $70.3&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of the 3.50% Convertible Notes with
	approximately $70.3&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of the Company's new 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Senior Notes due 2018 (the&nbsp;"3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes").
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	3.50% Convertible Notes were issued under an Indenture between the Company and The Bank of New&nbsp;York Mellon Trust Company, N.A., as trustee. Holders of the 3.50% Convertible
	Notes may convert their 3.50% Convertible Notes at any time until the close of business on the business day immediately preceding the maturity date. The 3.50% Convertible Notes are convertible, as
	described below into common stock of the Company at an initial conversion rate equal to 187.6877&nbsp;shares of common stock per $1,000 principal amount of the 3.50% Convertible Notes, which is
	equivalent to a conversion price of approximately $5.33 per share of common stock, subject to&nbsp;adjustment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Holders
	of the 3.50% Convertible Notes who convert their 3.50% Convertible Notes in connection with a "make-whole fundamental change", as defined in the Indenture, may be entitled to a
	make-whole
	premium in the form of an increase in the conversion rate. Additionally, in the event of a "fundamental change," as defined in the Indenture, holders of the 3.50% Convertible Notes may require the
	Company to purchase all or a portion of their 3.50% Convertible Notes at a fundamental change repurchase price equal to 100% of the principal amount of 3.50% Convertible Notes, plus accrued and unpaid
	interest, if any, to, but not including, the fundamental change repurchase&nbsp;date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In
	accordance with guidance in ASC 470-20,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Debt with Conversion and Other Options
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and ASC&nbsp;815-15,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Embedded
	Derivatives
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the Company determined that the embedded conversion components of the 3.50% Convertible Note do not require bifurcation and separate accounting. The remaining
	$44.7&nbsp;million principal amount of the 3.50% Convertible Note has been recorded in Long-term Debt on the consolidated balance sheet as of June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Senior Notes due February&nbsp;2018
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On April&nbsp;17, 2014, the Company entered into note exchange agreements with certain holders (the&nbsp;"Participating Holders")
	of the 3.50% Convertible Notes to refinance approximately $70.3&nbsp;million aggregate principal amount of the 3.50% Convertible Notes with approximately $70.3&nbsp;million aggregate principal
	amount of the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes. Pursuant to the note exchange agreements, the Company also paid the Participating Holders an aggregate of approximately $0.4&nbsp;million in
	cash in connection with such transactions. The principal amount of 3.50% Convertible Notes refinanced for each $1,000 principal amount of the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes was $1,000 and the
	amount in
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	123
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=123,EFW="2229520",CP="ACCURAY INCORPORATED",DN="1",CHK=793787,FOLIO='123',FILE='DISK123:[16ZBP1.16ZBP77301]FU77301A.;9',USER='ABEAULI',CD='22-AUG-2016;18:45' -->
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FU77301_1_124">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Accuray Incorporated
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Debt (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	cash
	paid per $1,000 principal amount of such 3.50% Convertible Notes delivered was determined in individual negotiations between the Company and each Participating Holder. The Series&nbsp;A
	Convertible Notes have the same interest rate, maturity and other terms as the 3.50% Convertible Notes, except that the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes are convertible into cash, shares of the
	Company's common stock or a combination of cash and shares of common stock, at the Company's option.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes were issued under an Indenture between the Company and The Bank of New&nbsp;York Mellon Trust Company, N.A., as trustee. Holders of the
	3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes may convert their Securities at any time on or after November&nbsp;1, 2017 until the close of business on the business day immediately preceding the maturity
	date. Prior to November&nbsp;1, 2017, holders of the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes may convert their Securities only under the following circumstances: (1)&nbsp;during any calendar
	quarter after the calendar quarter ending September&nbsp;30, 2014, and only during
	such calendar quarter, if the closing sale price of the Company's common stock for each of 20 or more trading days in the 30&nbsp;consecutive trading days ending on the last trading day of the
	immediately preceding calendar quarter exceeds 130% of the conversion price in effect on the last trading day of the immediately preceding calendar quarter; (2)&nbsp;during the five consecutive
	business days immediately after any five consecutive trading-day period (such five consecutive trading-day period, the "Note Measurement Period") in which the trading price per $1,000 principal amount
	of 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes for each trading day of that Securities Measurement Period was equal to or less than 98% of the product of the closing sale price of shares of the Company's
	common stock and the applicable conversion rate for such trading day; or (3)&nbsp;upon the occurrence of specified corporate transactions as described in the Indenture. Upon conversion by holders of
	the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes, the Company will have the right to pay or deliver, as the case may be, cash, shares of common stock of the Company or a combination thereof, at the
	Company's election. At any time on or prior to the 17th&nbsp;business day immediately preceding the maturity date, the Company may irrevocably elect to (a)&nbsp;deliver solely shares of common
	stock of the Company in respect of the Company's conversion obligation or (b)&nbsp;pay cash up to the aggregate principal amount of the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes to be converted and
	pay or deliver, as the case may be, cash, shares of common stock of the Company or a combination thereof in respect of the remainder, if any, of the Company's conversion obligation in excess of the
	aggregate principal amount of the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes being converted. The initial conversion rate is 187.6877&nbsp;shares of the Company's common stock per $1,000 principal
	amount of 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes (which represents an initial conversion price of approximately $5.33 per share of the Company's common stock). The conversion rate, and thus the
	conversion price, is subject to adjustment as further described below.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Holders
	of the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes who convert their Notes in connection with a "make-whole fundamental change", as defined in the Indenture, may be entitled to a
	make-whole premium in the form of an increase in the conversion rate. Additionally, in the event of a "fundamental change," as defined in the Indenture, holders of the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A
	Convertible Notes may require the Company to purchase all or a portion of their 3.50% Convertible Notes at a fundamental change repurchase price equal to 100% of the principal amount of the 3.50%
	Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to, but not including, the fundamental change repurchase&nbsp;date.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	124
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Accuray Incorporated
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	12. Debt (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In accordance with Accounting Standards Codification, or ASC 470-20,
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Debt with Conversion and Other Options
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	, the Company separately
	accounts for the liability and equity conversion components of the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes. The principal amount of the liability component of the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible
	Notes was $62.5&nbsp;million as of the date of issuance based on the present value of its cash flows using a discount rate of 7%, our approximate borrowing rate at the date of the issuance for a
	similar debt instrument without the conversion feature. The carrying value of the equity conversion component was $7.9&nbsp;million. In addition, the portion of the cash amount paid to the
	Participating
	Holders totaling $0.4&nbsp;million was allocated to the debt discount with the remaining $47,000 to the equity component. The liability component is being accreted to the principal amount of the
	3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes using the effective interest method through the maturity in February&nbsp;2018.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	following table presents the carrying values of all Convertible Notes and notes issued pursuant to the Secured Loan (collectively, "Notes") as of June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2016:
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As
	of June&nbsp;30, 2016, the remaining period over which the unamortized debt discount of the 3.75% Convertible Notes will be amortized is 1&nbsp;month using an effective interest
	rate of 10.9%; the remaining amortization period of the 3.50% Series&nbsp;A Convertible Notes is 19&nbsp;months using an effective interest rate of&nbsp;7.10%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	13. Employee Benefit Plans
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company's employee savings and retirement plan is qualified under Section&nbsp;401(k) of the United&nbsp;States Internal Revenue Code. Employees may make voluntary, tax-deferred
	contributions to the 401(k) Plan up to the statutorily prescribed annual limit. The Company makes discretionary
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	125
</FONT>
</P>
<HR NOSHADE>
<P STYLE='FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
</P>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=125,EFW="2229520",CP="ACCURAY INCORPORATED",DN="1",CHK=884945,FOLIO='125',FILE='DISK123:[16ZBP1.16ZBP77301]FW77301A.;13',USER='DNICHOL',CD='23-AUG-2016;13:15' -->
<A NAME="A2229520Z10-K_HTM_PAGE_FW77301_1_126">
</A>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<A HREF="#A2229520Z10-K_HTM_BG77301A_MAIN_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<BR>
	Accuray Incorporated
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
	Notes to Consolidated Financial Statements (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	13. Employee Benefit Plans (Continued)
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	matching
	contributions to the 401(k) Plan on behalf of employees up to the limit determined by the Board of Directors. The Company contributed $2.1&nbsp;million, $2.3&nbsp;million and
	$2.1&nbsp;million to the 401(k) Plan during the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015 and 2014, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	14. Defined Benefit Pension Obligation
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company has established a defined pension plan for its employees in the Switzerland subsidiary. The plan provides benefits to employees upon retirement, death or disability. The
	Company uses June&nbsp;30 as the year-end measurement date for this plan. The unfunded liability of $2.9&nbsp;million was recognized in long-term other liabilities in the accompanying balance
	sheet as of June&nbsp;30, 2016. Actuarial loss of $0.5&nbsp;million was recognized in other comprehensive loss in fiscal&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_48"></A>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Estimated Contributions and Future Benefit Payments
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company made contributions of approximately $1.2&nbsp;million to the defined benefit pension plans during fiscal years 2016 and
	2015, respectively. The Company expects total contributions to the defined benefit pension plans for fiscal year 2017 will be approximately $1.3&nbsp;million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	128
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	Plan Assets
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The plan assets are invested in insurance contracts with Swiss Life Foundation BVG (BVG) insurance company based in Zurich, Switzerland
	at the end of fiscal 2016 and 2015 and are expected to be invested 100% in insurance contracts in fiscal 2017, which is reinsured by Swiss Life&nbsp;Ltd (SLL). SLL invests the vested pension capital
	and provides a 100% capital and interest rate guarantee as negotiated by the Company. In 2016, the Company negotiated a guaranteed interest rate of 1.25% for mandatory retirement savings and 0.75% for
	supplementary retirement savings. The pension plan is entitled to an annual bonus from the SLL comprising the effective savings, risk and cost results. The technical administration and management of
	the savings account are guaranteed by the SLL on behalf of BVG. Insurance benefits due are paid directly to the entitled persons by the SLL in the name of and for the account of the collective
	foundation. The Company has committed itself to pay the annual contributions and costs due under the pension fund regulations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
	contract of affiliation between the Company and BVG can be terminated by either side. In the event of a termination, recipients of retirement and survivors' benefits would remain
	with the collective foundation. The Company commits itself to transfer its active insured members and recipients of disability benefits to the new employee benefits institution, thus releasing BVG
	from all obligations.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	15. Segment Disclosure
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company has one operating and reporting segment (oncology systems group), which develops, manufactures and markets proprietary medical devices used in radiation therapy for the
	treatment of cancer patients. The Company's Chief Executive Officer, its Chief Operating Decision Maker reviews financial information presented on a consolidated basis for purposes of making operating
	decisions and assessing financial performance. The Company does not assess the performance of its individual
	product lines on measures of profit or loss, or asset based metrics. Therefore, the information below is presented only for revenues and long-lived tangible assets by geographic areas.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	129
</FONT>
</P>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	16. Restructuring Charges
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;As part of the Company's plan to enhance operational performance through productivity initiatives, the Company implemented a re-alignment of its workforce during the fourth quarter of
	fiscal year 2016. The re-alignment affected approximately 3% of the Company's total workforce. The Company incurred approximately $2.5&nbsp;million, $1.4&nbsp;million, and zero in restructuring
	charges in connection with its workforce re-alignment for the years ended June&nbsp;30, 2016, 2015, and 2014. These restructuring charges are included in cost of goods sold and operating expenses in
	the consolidated statements of operations. The Company had approximately $2.5&nbsp;million and $1.3&nbsp;million in accrued restructuring charges included in accrued compensation in the
	consolidated balance sheets as of June&nbsp;30, 2016 and 2015, respectively.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	130
</FONT>
</P>

<FONT SIZE=2>
<B>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-0PT;" -->
	18. Subsequent Event
</B>
</FONT>
</P>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;;MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
<!-- COMMAND=STYLE_ADDED,"MARGIN-LEFT:10.0PT;TEXT-INDENT:-10.0PT;" -->
	3.75% Convertible Senior Notes
</I>
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On August&nbsp;1, 2016, the Company settled the remaining 3.75% Convertible Senior Notes for approximately $36.6&nbsp;million
	aggregate principal amount and $0.7&nbsp;million accrued interest for approximately $37.3&nbsp;million in cash. In settling the notes for cash, during the January&nbsp;2016 retirement as further
	described in
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
<I>
	Note&nbsp;12 Debt
</I>
</FONT>
<FONT SIZE=2>
	and the August&nbsp;2016 transaction, the Company avoided the issuance of approximately 10.6&nbsp;million new
	common equity shares, representing a potential dilution of approximately 13&nbsp;percent as of June&nbsp;30,&nbsp;2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES;">
<FONT SIZE=2>
	131
</FONT>
</P>
